revised_title: Induction of Noradrenaline and Dopamine Receptors in Xenopus Oocytes with Rat Brain mRNA
tldr: Researchers discovered that injecting Xenopus oocytes with poly(A)+ mRNA isolated from rat brain induced noradrenaline and dopamine receptors in the oocytes. The induced receptors caused oscillatory inward membrane currents, which were mainly carried by chloride ions. This study provided insights into signal transmission across chemical synapses in the brain and the role of receptor messengers in adult brain cells.
